intro: Mesembryanthemum niveum, commonly known as the snowflake flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is known for its succulent characteristics and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in response to morning dew, giving it its common name. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Mesembryanthemum niveum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils.
